newsitem.title: CHINA: Motorola, Panda jv sees turnover of 100,000 PCs.
newsitem.headline: Motorola, Panda jv sees turnover of 100,000 PCs.

text.p: Computer producer Nanjing Shuanqiang said on Tuesday it expects to produce up to 100,000 personal computers a year by 1997.
Nanjing Shuanqiang is a joint venture between U.S. technology giant Motorola Inc and Nanjing Panda Electronics Co Ltd.
Most products will be exported under the Motorola brand, a company official said.
The company plans to double its annual capacity to 200,000 in the next three or four years, he said.
Shuanqiang, which began operation earlier this month, has a total investment of $12.2 million and is 60 percent-owned by Motorola and 40 percent by Nanjing Panda, the official said.
